frameDefinitions: In this frame an Agent or Cause changes the consistency of a Patient from its Initial_state to a Result.
A Cause or Agent causes a Patient to undergo a change of phase.
An Item is in a state of wetness with the possibility of the wetting Liquid being mentioned, along with the Degree of wetness. '
A Guest stays for a time at a Location, which is not his or her permanent residence, for some Duration.
An Entity is judged by a sound Attribute of some perceived level of Volume intensity.
In this frame a Patient is in a phase brought about after a change of phase.
frameExamples: Donna <t>thinned</t> the soup with chicken broth.
The mop is <t>drenched</t> with water from last night's rain.
I usually <t>stay</t> with my aunt at her summer house when I go to Seville.
Collect up the  <t>thawed</t> water from the freezer section.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that undergoes a change.
The <fen>Agent</fen> causes the change of consistency in the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-<fen>Agent</fen> which brings about the change in the <fen>Patient</fen>.
When the <fen>Patient</fen> changes consistency.
Where the the <fen>Patient</fen> changes consistency.
The <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Patient</fen> to change phase.
The <fen>Patient</fen> undergoes a change of phase brought about by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-<fen>Agent</fen> which brings about the change in the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the Time at which the change of phase occurs.
This role identifies the place where change of phase occurs.
The <fen>Item</fen> takes up the <fen>Liquid</fen> through its pores.
The <fen>Liquid</fen> is a fluid or gas that permeates the <fen>Item</fen>.  It most frequently occurs in a PP Complement headed by with.
The <fen>Guest</fen> remains for a relatively short period of time in the <fen>Location</fen>.
The <fen>Location</fen> where the <fen>Guest</fen> spends a short amount of time.
The length of time that the <fen>Guest</fen> remains at the <fen>Location</fen>.
The <fen>Host</fen> is living at the <fen>Location</fen> on a permanent basis, and is allowing the <fen>Guest</fen> to stay there.
The time at which the temporary stay takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates the larger physical setting of the temporary stay.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the sound level <fen>Attribute</fen> is under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under consideration. This role is incorporated in each LU in the frame.
A quantity or characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s sound output with repspect to its <fen>Attribute</fen>.
A modifier expressing the deviation of the <fen>Volume</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Volume</fen> for the <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The place where an <fen>Entity</fen> is located.
The <fen>Substance</fen> is the entity which has had its phase altered.
listRoleExamples: The mop was drenched <fex> with water</fex>.
Originally, <fex>we</fex> planned on rooming with our relatives in Reno.
Originally we planned on staying <fex>at the Hilton</fex>.
My wife and have just returned from a <fex>two day</fex> stay at Ocean Key.
You should avoid staying <fex>with old college buddies</fex> when on business trips.
<fex>In London</fex>, I stayed at a hotel.
